result.execSummary:
The defendant Rafael Lamont Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).
  • Battery or Threat to a Witness, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.201(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection. DOC to collect all monetary amounts at the rate of 25%.
Court finds defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program, but is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program after serving 18 months.

superMiscConds.notes: Court advises the defendant he cannot possess firearms

No violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause.
No contact with Officer Ashley Van Drisse.

Pay any monetary amounts ordered but not paid while in the institution.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Random urine screening.
Defendant to provide a biological speciment for DNA analysis and pay the DNA surcharge if not already done.
Restitution is set at 0.
Court advises the defendant cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.
AODA, programs or treatment as recommended

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to a Witness
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rafael Lamont Johnson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Filed, signed Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment.  The Court Orders the petition for sentence adjustment is denied because it is not in the public interest. Copies to the District Attorney's Office and defendant.
District Attorney Response to Petition for Sentence Adjustment received and filed.
This case has been assigned to the Hon. Timothy M. Witkowiak, Br. 22, as calendar successor.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. J.D. Watts, Br. 15, calendar successor, for review. mag
Count two.
Decision and Order Denying Request to Modify Judgment of Conviction, signed and filed. cmt
Per order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Daniel L. Konkol, Br. 44, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se request for amended judgment with respect to ERP eligibility timeframe.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  1) no violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay any monetary amounts ordered but not paid while in the institution; 3) AODA, programs or treatment as recommended; 4) maintain absolute sobriety; 5) random screening; 6) seek and maintain employment; 7) no contact with Officer Ashley Van Drisse. 

COURT ORDERS:
- DOC to collect all monetary amounts at the rate of 25% 
- defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis and pay the DNA surcharge if not already done
- restitution is set at -0-.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

Defendant Rafael Lamont Johnson in court with attorney Robert L Taylor.  Defendant Rafael Lamont Johnson in custody.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Sentencing proceeds.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by counsel and defendant.  

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample if not previously provided and pay the DNA surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

Count 1:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 2 years with 44 days credit; INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 1 year; EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 1 year; pay costs, assessments  and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

Count 2:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 4 years; INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 2 years; EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 2 years - concurrent with Count 1; pay costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

Court finds defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program, but is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program after serving 18 months.

Defendant Rafael Lamont Johnson in court with attorney Robert L Taylor.  Defendant Rafael Lamont Johnson in custody.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to COUNT 1 and NO CONTEST to COUNT 2 and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, victim, a friend or relative of the defendant and defendant.  Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court by 8:30 a.m.  
Court orders Defendant remanded. 
Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 17, 2014 at 09:00 am.
State's Witness List, State's Motion in Limine and State's Requested Jury Instructions and Instructions received and filed./ds

Attorney Robert L Taylor in court, defendant Rafael Lamont Johnson not in court, in custody.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Pretrial scheduling order received and filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for February 17, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Rafael Lamont Johnson not in court, defendant in custody.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Attorney Taylor was having the telephone system at his office serviced and cannot appear.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.
CORRECTION TO ENTRY OF JANUARY 17, 2014.

CORRECTION TO ENTRY OF JANUARY 17, 2014.
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Bail amended to $10,000 CASH.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.
Speedy trial demand.

Defendant Rafael Lamont Johnson in court with attorney Robert L Taylor.  Defendant Rafael Lamont Johnson in custody.  Nathaniel Adamson for Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Jason Schulz-MPD Officer. Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #03CF5551 that are attached to the complaint. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 44.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MPD OFFICER ASHLEY VAN DRISSE.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring AND DRUG TESTING, BREATHALYZER TESTS AND ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Defendant Rafael Lamont Johnson in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Rafael Lamont Johnson in custody.  Kurt Benkley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Motion to dismiss by defense argued and DENIED by the Court.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge KONKOL, Branch 44.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
